laboratory_examinations.findings: White-cell count of 11,150 per cubic millimeter with 83% polymorphonuclear leukocytes, 10% lymphocytes, 5% mononuclear cells, 1% eosinophils, and 1% basophils. Hematocrit was 30.1%, and platelet count was 339,000 per cubic millimeter.

Potassium level of 2.9 mmol per liter (normal range, 3.5 to 5.0), glucose level of 287 mg per deciliter (normal range, 60 to 99), albumin level of 1.9 g per deciliter (normal range, 3.5 to 5.5), and total protein level of 5.0 g per deciliter (normal range, 6.0 to 8.2).
Patchy infiltrates and cavitary lesion in the right upper lobe.
Confirmed cavitary lesion and multiple smaller infiltrates throughout the right lung.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Showed a reduction in the size of the lung cavity after treatment.
Analysis showed improvement during the hospitalization period.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 4 white cells per cubic millimeter with normal glucose and protein levels.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Gram Staining of Induced Sputum, Blood, and CSF

laboratory_examinations.findings: Gram-negative bacilli identified from drainage material grew and were identified as oxidase-positive.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Identified as Burkholderia pseudomallei on the ninth hospital day.
